chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott Alan Walztoni was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Msg from DE forwarded to me from Criminal Clerk @ 1:25 pm today requesting to make his pymt by the end of the day tomrw as the Final Notice states pymt is due by today.  Ret'd call to DE & left him a v/m denying his request as he waited until the last date of his grace period to call.  DE was advised to make the pymt before 8 am tomrw or he will be issued a WA tomrw.  DE was also advised to plan his paychecks accordingly & that it is recommended he make his Oct pymt w/his next paycheck after tomrw as pymt will be expected on time for Oct. DE was given a case # to reference in the future & for pymt purposes. Includes 14CM414, 14CF262, 15TR2319, 15TR2833, 15TR2942, 15TR3203. jaf
Final notice sent, due 9-21-17. cah

DE was able to make his Aug pymt before WA was issued.  Letter filed and Pymt Plan to resume as scheduled - next pymt due 9-10-17.  Includes 14CM414, 14CF262, 15TR2319, 15TR2833, 15TR2942, 15TR3203. jaf

From DE on 8-24-17 @ 3:07 pm stating that his pymt is due today, but he cannot pay it until he gets pd tomrw at 2 pm & will pay before 5 pm.  Ret'd call to DE today @ 10:30 am stating his pymt is due immediately after he gets pd as he is due to be warranted today & I will not guarantee that the WA will not be issued.  DE was reminded that his next pymt of $50 is due 9-10-17 & must be pd on time.  Includes 14CM414, 14CF262, 15TR2319, 15TR2833, 15TR2942, 15TR3203. jaf

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot, ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Christopher Stephen Petros   DF:  Scott Alan Walztoni appeared. Includes 16CF326, 16CF396, 12CM122 and 16CM417. Case called at 9:45 am. Atty's request a plea date. Def has written letter to get license reinstated. Court vacates suspension on payment plan. Court will not modify bond.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 17, 2017 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Scott Alan Walztoni
Current: 1784 176th Street, New Richmond, WI 54017 United States  (Effective: 04-05-2017)
Prior: 900 N 4th St, c/o The Salvation Army, Minneapolis, MN 55401 United States
Updated per change of address form signed by DE. jl

DE called to verify if his fax request was rec'd on 3-03-17.  DE was advised that I do not see anything docketed nor do I see that it is waiting to be docketed.  DE stated he is planning to pay $1000 to pay off his Traffic cases so he can reinstate his license.  DE was advised that the traffic cases cannot be removed from a Pymt Plan & pymts typically get applied to the older cases first, but he may still make the pymt & submit a letter.  DE was also advised to make his pymt first before sending his request so that the receipt can be sent down w/his letter for proof of pymt.  DE was advised if the Judge does choose to reinstate his license, DE to also remain faithful to his Pymt Plan or his license would be re-suspended immediately.  Includes 14CM414, 14CF262, 15TR2319, 15TR2833, 15TR2942, 15TR3203. jaf

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk:Fox, ADA:  Kevin H. Gehler, DF:  Scott Alan Walztoni appeared from jail, pro se. Def thought payments started in September. Court QUASHES WARRANT for failure to pay. Defendant can be released. Payment plan in reinstated with a start date of September 10, 2014. Def must be $30.00 by September 10, 2014.

Signed by SRN 8/27/2014
cc; Defendant & Sheriff   rs

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Brian Thomas Smestad   DF:  Scott Alan Walztoni appeared. Set for preliminary. Case called at 8:43. Agreement has been reached. ADA Nieskes moves to amend Count 1 to 961.573(1). Possession of Drug Paraphernalia. DE pleads no contest to Amended Count 1 and guilty to Count 2. DE sworn. Court informs DE of rights. Attorneys stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily, and knowingly makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Amended Count 1 - 961.573(1) and Count 2. Recommendations by Attorneys. DE makes statement. Court orders:  3 days jail, credit for time served. Court costs for both counts. DE to meet with payment clerk today.
Filed by Atty Smestad. km
signed by SRN 6/29/14. eif
Appointing Atty Smestad. km
Preliminary hearing on July 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Baseline test before release from jail.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Random testing with probable cause.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael E Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Brian T Smestad,  DF:  Scott Alan Walztoni appeared from jail. Defendant does qualify for PD.  Court confirms address. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Waive speedy prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
